body:
For this proposal, we have the benefit of observing the Monero networks adoption to this alogrithm. Below is a list of helpful videos that document how the transition from CryptoNight to RandomX worked out:
- A recap right after the hard fork by Red Panda Mining: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LjgD6GZpXeQ

Notes:
- Hashrate immeditely tripled with the change to CPU from CryptoNight
- Mining profitiability dropped with the increase in hashrate
- supply chain: readily available CPUs on the market. A big improvement from the ECIP-1049 proposal 
- Many miners already have CPUs sitting around, low investment needed for miner to support the ETC network under RandomX.
- Software available to dual mine RandomX and Ethash. To retain GPU mining participants.

This algo will allow anyone to participate in the Ethereum Classic mining ecosystem. Here is an example of a RnadomX home build:
https://youtu.be/ARJlaWAZjcw
June 2020 RandomX Results: https://youtu.be/Z_CxGoEt1_o
